text: My name is Karol Kozłowski.
I was born on 10.05.2002r. at the Municipal Hospital
in Sosnowiec, on Emila Zegadłowicza Street 3, postal code 41-200.
Mother Agnieszka, Father Tomasz, greetings to you both.
The city I come from is a place everyone in Poland likes to joke
about. Honestly, I'm not entirely sure why.
It's not the prettiest, but I've seen worse, and yes, we don't even have
a market square. Currently, I live in Warsaw, the so-called City of Wonders,
Innovation, and occasional degeneration.
But speaking seriously, I like our capital because it shows how much our country
has developed since the economic transformation.
Useless information is like an addiction, never enough.
Professionally, I work as a DevOps engineer for one of the larger fintech companies
in the world, Visa Incorporated.
Remember, dear viewer, Visa is not a bank nor a creator of debit or
credit cards, but a global system that settles money between financial institutions.
Basically, a very advanced machine for moving numbers from one place to another.
DevOps? Sounds exotic, but in practice, it's about providing unified,
scalable infrastructure for IT projects and broadly understood process automation.
To avoid drowning you in buzzwords, feel free to check the section dedicated to
my experience, where I explain it a bit more.
What do I have in common with goats besides a noble-sounding surname?
Well, I record a podcast called Rozmowy z Kozłem, from young people for everyone.
You'll find the link on the website or in the dedicated podcast section.
Privately, I'm also an investor.
In practice, that means part of my hard-earned money has already been both lost
and multiplied across cryptocurrencies, stocks, and precious metals.
And speaking seriously, I believe the current monetary system and broader macroeconomic conditions put
significant pressure on the middle class.
That's why investing can sometimes be one of the few trampolines forward.
Remember, however, that investing involves risk, and this is absolutely not financial advice,
and I sincerely hope you won't blindly listen to some random guy from Warsaw
on the internet. Educationally, things have happened, too.
I graduated in Applied Computer Science from AGH University of Science and Technology in
Kraków. Currently, I'm pursuing a master's degree at Warsaw University of Technology,
although I've taken an academic leave for a while to live a bit more
and catch up on projects outside university.
In short, I study, but with distance from academic drama.
My motto: "Be hardy in your approbation and lavish in your praise." From which
book? All right, that's enough.
Cheers, and may the content click well!
